title: Instructional Design Problem-Solving Process: Heuristic Exploration Based on the Delphi Technique

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Instructional Design Theory and Practical Experience
context.additional_context: A course for in-service professionals to acquire practical heuristics for solving instructional design problems, deriving core principles through collective intelligence using the Delphi technique.

learning_goals: Learners can apply five or more heuristics to systematically analyze complex problems arising in the instructional design process.
Learners can explain the procedure for deriving expert consensus using the Delphi technique in three or more stages.
Learners can apply instructional design strategies based on the IBSTPI competency framework to two or more actual cases.
Through team collaboration, learners can develop one project deliverable for solving instructional design problems.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
